alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Kankakee; Kendall; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 7:57PM CDT until May 08 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Grundy County in northeastern Illinois... Kankakee County in northeastern Illinois... Kendall County in northeastern Illinois... Will County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 757 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate slow-moving, heavy thunderstorms which have produced up to 3 inches of rain across a narrow corridor from near near Wilmington to near Manteno to near Grant Park. These thunderstorms are expected to continue producing rain rates of 1 to 3 inches per hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Joliet, Plainfield, Oswego, Kankakee, New Lenox, Park Forest, Mokena, Bourbonnais, Frankfort, Yorkville, Bradley, Morris, Channahon, Minooka, Plano, Steger, Manteno, Sandwich, Braidwood and Wilmington. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
